intro: Adenophora remotiflora f. leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered bellflower, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is native to parts of East Asia, including China. The plant features hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its flowers are predominantly white, with some varieties displaying pale blue or pink hues. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or mountainous regions.
